channel.title: AWS on Some Title
channel.description: Recent content in AWS on Some Title

item.title: [AWS] Data migration from DynamoDB to Aurora MySQL
item.description: I have migrated data from DynamoDB to Aurora MySQL, so I will write the method. Please note that the data migration does not mean that all tables are migrated because we have migrated the data stored in one table. Method I think there are several possible ways to migrate from DynamoDB to Aurora MySQL, but I wrote the code in disposable (?) Python to make the transition quickly and reliably Even though it is disposable, there is a possibility that data may be migrated again, so we made it possible to reuse

item.title: Established a mechanism to download a large zip file by aws with Basic authentication
item.description: # Article content in three lines Let’s use EC2 and framework It can not be assembled without server (it can be assembled but NG due to capacity limitation) API Gateway convenient (difficult) Overview When sharing a large file, if it exceeds about 8MB for mail, it will be blocked because it is a mail server. Even if it is not blocked, I think that it is quite annoying to send a large file by mail to the server in the first place.

item.title: Setting up Digest authentication using Python @Lambda
item.description: #Introduction There was almost no information when I searched for Digest authentication, so I wrote it as a sequel to Basic authentication setting @ Lambda using Python. I have barely touched Digest authentication itself, and I also learned the mechanism. #Code import os import ctypes import json import base64 import time import hashlib import copy from Crypto.Cipher import AES accounts = [ { "user": "user1", "pass": "pass1" }, { "user": "user2", "pass": "pass2" } ] realm = "sample@test.

item.title: [AWS] I made a reminder BOT with LINE WORKS (implementation)
item.description: It is the 14th day of LINEWORKS Advent Calendar. This time, we will introduce the implementation of the reminder BOT introduced in LINEWORKS Advent Calendar Day 7. [Repost] BOT screen and overall structure The reminder BOT consists of three Lambda, and is implemented with Python3.7. ①. Processing of messages sent from LINE WORKS and notification to SQS ②. Poll the events stored in the table and notify SQS ③. Notify the LINEWORKS server of the message received from SQS

item.title: Use a command to upload data to s3 of aws and update it, and delete the used data (on the way)
item.description: [Install AWS CLI version 1](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/ja_jp/cli/latest/userguide/install-cliv1.html) Install the latest version of the AWS CLI pip3 install awscli --upgrade --user It seems that you can install it, but aws --version Then, zsh: command not found: aws Will appear… Add AWS CLI version 1 executable to macOS command line path Based on the above article, “Add aws program to PATH environment variable of operating system”. →But after all zsh: command not found: aws Will it come out…?

item.title: Rewriting Lambda to restart Workspaces of UNHEALTHY with python
item.description: I'll do Hands Lab Advent Calendar this year as well Overview We use Workspaces, a service that provides virtual desktops for AWS, Sometimes it’s unhealthy \ Broken without doing anything / Most of the time, it is possible to manage by restarting due to a temporary load drop. So there is Lambda that restarts for the time being It’s written in Node.js, so it supports frequent version upgrades… It’s simple code, so I thought I’d rewrite it to python anyway

item.title: ``First time learning'' that even university students with no knowledge can do-AWS SageMaker
item.description: # My background Amazon? Ah, you know, you know, a mail order app. Not long ago, knowledge about Amazon was that much. Of course, I didn’t even know AWS. I’m ashamed as an information undergraduate student. However, as a 3rd year university student, I was introduced to the lab and learned about AWS. In addition, I am addicted to the topic “Atsuhiko Nakata’s YouTube University”, which is a hot topic in this street.
